comment.body: Thanks. Removed.

Ah right, I forgot about DNS blocking. Not sure how to solve it with DNS blocking. 

For some reasons, I can't reproduce the issue now (there's no `youborafds01.com`, not sure if it's because of different US IP addresses or not). 

If I remember correctly, the `a-fds.youborafds01.com/data?` connection's response returns `youboranqs01.com` domain which is used as a domain for next connections. If `a-fds.youborafds01.com/data?` is blocked, the connection will have `undefined` as a domain which would create a loop of invalid connections.

---

> `https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-04-14/etsy-artisans-shoppers-poised-for-pain-as-tariff-loophole-ends?embedded-checkout=true`

This link works fine for me without exceptions though. In fact the only issue I saw with `a-fds.youborafds01.com` is with `pluto.tv`, including in uBO's issue threads.

@AdamWr Sorry, can you reproduce the issue?

I tried

```adb
niyogbd.xyz#@#div[id^="div-gpt-"]

#@#ins.adsbygoogle[data-ad-slot]
```

but the generic cosmetic rules still apply on Firefox:

```adb
##ins.adsbygoogle[data-ad-slot]
##div[id^="div-gpt-"]
```

Regarding - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/203347#issue-3001256190
> With the base filtre enabled any click on the shopping does not work

I guess that it may happens only after clicking on some specific links.

```adblock
@@||googleadservices.com/pagead/aclk*ohost=*.google.*$document
```

comment.body:
Regarding - `https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-04-14/etsy-artisans-shoppers-poised-for-pain-as-tariff-loophole-ends?embedded-checkout=true`, it's behind paywall and video does not work without ad blocker on my end.
I checked out a different link - `https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2025-04-10/why-trump-unleashed-tariff-chaos-video`, I see that `youborafds01.com` request is blocked but video works correctly.

<hr>

Back to the `pluto.tv`, I can reproduce breakage on this page only on the first visit. It looks like that it spams with `https://undefined/infinity/session/beat?timemark=` request when `youborafds01.com` is blocked and then website breaks.
Maybe we could also add a scriptlet to prevent it?
This:
```adblock
pluto.tv#%#//scriptlet('abort-on-stack-trace', 'Date.prototype.getTime', 'startSessionHeartBeat')
```
seems to works fine on my end. The "aborted" script is inside `try...catch` so it rather should not breaks something and it should not spam with this request.

Известно, что эта проблема решается с помощью AdGuard Extra.

Если вы пользуетесь AdGuard на устройствах Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включена в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете расширение AdGuard для браузера, рекомендуется также установить AdGuard Extra.

* [Установка на браузеры Chrome, Edge или другие, основанные на Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установка на Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)
